vsim.utils

Class Data

  • java.lang.Object
    • vsim.utils.Data

  • public final class Data
extends java.lang.Object
    The class Data contains useful methods, constants and masks for data manipulation in VSim.

    • Method Detail

      • signExtend

        public static int signExtend(int value,
                             int bits)
        This method sign-extends a value of N bits (N < 32) to 32 bits.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to sign-extend
        bits - the number of bits that this number represents
        Returns:
        the sign-extended value
        See Also:
        signExtendByte(int), signExtendHalf(int)

      • signExtendByte

        public static int signExtendByte(int value)
        This method sign-extends a byte to 32 bits.
        Parameters:
        value - the byte to sign-extend
        Returns:
        the sign-extended byte
        See Also:
        signExtend(int, int), signExtendHalf(int)

      • signExtendHalf

        public static int signExtendHalf(int value)
        This method sign-extends a half to 32 bits.
        Parameters:
        value - the half to sign-extend
        Returns:
        the sign-extended half
        See Also:
        signExtend(int, int), signExtendByte(int)

      • isWordAligned

        public static boolean isWordAligned(int address)
        This method verifies if an address is aligned to a word boundary.
        Parameters:
        address - the address to verify
        Returns:
        true if address is word aligned, false if not
        See Also:
        alignToWordBoundary(int)

      • alignToWordBoundary

        This method aligns an address to a word boundary if necessary.
        Parameters:
        address - the address to word align
        Returns:
        the word aligned address
        See Also:
        isWordAligned(int)

      • inRange

        public static boolean inRange(int value,
                              int low,
                              int high)
        This method verifies if a value is in a given range [low, high].
        Parameters:
        value - the value to verify
        low - the low value of the range (included)
        high - the high value of the range (included)
        Returns:
        true if the value is in the range, false if not

      • validHalf

        public static boolean validHalf(int value)
        This method verifies if a value is a valid half value, i.e is in the range [HALF_MIN_VALUE, HALF_MAX_VALUE]
        Parameters:
        value - the value to verify
        Returns:
        true if the value is a valid half value, false if not
        See Also:
        inRange(int, int, int)

      • validByte

        public static boolean validByte(int value)
        This method verifies if a value is a valid byte value, i.e is in the range [BYTE_MIN_VALUE, BYTE_MAX_VALUE].
        Parameters:
        value - the value to verify
        Returns:
        true if the value is a valid byte value, false if not
        See Also:
        inRange(int, int, int)

      • signalingNaN

        public static boolean signalingNaN(float f)
        This method verifies if a float value is a signaling NaN.
        Parameters:
        f - float value to verify
        Returns:
        true if the float value is a signaling NaN, false if not

        Returns:
        true if the float value is a quiet NaN, false if not.
